trans-unit.source: Tutorial: Azure Active Directory integration with Boomi | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Tutorial: Azure Active Directory integration with Boomi | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to use Boomi with Azure Active Directory to enable single sign-on, automated provisioning, and more!.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to use Boomi with Azure Active Directory to enable single sign-on, automated provisioning, and more!.

trans-unit.source: For feedback, click <linkText>here</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For feedback, click <linkText>here</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: The objective of this tutorial is to show the integration of Azure and Boomi.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this tutorial is to show the integration of Azure and Boomi.

trans-unit.source: The scenario outlined in this tutorial assumes that you already have the following items:
trans-unit.target: The scenario outlined in this tutorial assumes that you already have the following items:

trans-unit.source: A valid Azure subscription
trans-unit.target: A valid Azure subscription

trans-unit.source: A Boomi single sign-on enabled subscription
trans-unit.target: A Boomi single sign-on enabled subscription

trans-unit.source: After completing this tutorial, the Azure AD users you have assigned to Boomi will be able to single sign into the application at your Boomi company site (service provider initiated sign on), or using the <linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: After completing this tutorial, the Azure AD users you have assigned to Boomi will be able to single sign into the application at your Boomi company site (service provider initiated sign on), or using the <linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: The scenario outlined in this tutorial consists of the following building blocks:
trans-unit.target: The scenario outlined in this tutorial consists of the following building blocks:

trans-unit.source: Enabling the application integration for Boomi
trans-unit.target: Enabling the application integration for Boomi

trans-unit.source: Configuring single sign-on
trans-unit.target: Configuring single sign-on

trans-unit.source: Configuring user provisioning
trans-unit.target: Configuring user provisioning

trans-unit.source: Assigning users
trans-unit.target: Assigning users

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Scenario</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Scenario</linkText>

trans-unit.source: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable the application integration for Boomi.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable the application integration for Boomi.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure Management Portal, on the left navigation pane, click Active Directory.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure Management Portal, on the left navigation pane, click Active Directory.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Active Directory</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Active Directory</linkText>

trans-unit.source: From the Directory list, select the directory for which you want to enable directory integration.
trans-unit.target: From the Directory list, select the directory for which you want to enable directory integration.

trans-unit.source: To open the applications view, in the directory view, click Applications in the top menu.
trans-unit.target: To open the applications view, in the directory view, click Applications in the top menu.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Applications</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Applications</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click Add at the bottom of the page.
trans-unit.target: Click Add at the bottom of the page.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Add application</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Add application</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the What do you want to do dialog, click Add an application from the gallery.
trans-unit.target: On the What do you want to do dialog, click Add an application from the gallery.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Add an application from gallerry</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Add an application from gallerry</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the search box, type Boomi.
trans-unit.target: In the search box, type Boomi.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Application Gallery</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Application Gallery</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the results pane, select Boomi, and then click Complete to add the application.
trans-unit.target: In the results pane, select Boomi, and then click Complete to add the application.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Boomi</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Boomi</linkText>

trans-unit.source: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable users to authenticate to Boomi with their account in Azure AD using federation based on the SAML protocol.
trans-unit.target: The objective of this section is to outline how to enable users to authenticate to Boomi with their account in Azure AD using federation based on the SAML protocol.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure AD portal, on the Boomi application integration page, click Configure single sign-on to open the *Configure Single Sign On * dialog.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure AD portal, on the Boomi application integration page, click Configure single sign-on to open the *Configure Single Sign On * dialog.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the How would you like users to sign on to Boomi page, select Microsoft Azure AD Single Sign-On, and then click Next.
trans-unit.target: On the How would you like users to sign on to Boomi page, select Microsoft Azure AD Single Sign-On, and then click Next.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the Configure App URL page, in the Boomi Reply URL textbox, type your Boomi AtomSphere Login URL (e.g.: “https://platform.boomi.com/sso/AccountName/saml”), and then click Next.
trans-unit.target: On the Configure App URL page, in the Boomi Reply URL textbox, type your Boomi AtomSphere Login URL (e.g.: “https://platform.boomi.com/sso/AccountName/saml”), and then click Next.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure App URL</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure App URL</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the Configure single sign-on at Boomi page, to download your certificate, click Download certificate, and then save the certificate file locally on your computer.
trans-unit.target: On the Configure single sign-on at Boomi page, to download your certificate, click Download certificate, and then save the certificate file locally on your computer.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In a different web browser window, log into your Boomi company site as an administrator.
trans-unit.target: In a different web browser window, log into your Boomi company site as an administrator.

trans-unit.source: In the toolbar on the top, click your company name, and then Setup.
trans-unit.target: In the toolbar on the top, click your company name, and then Setup.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Setup</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Setup</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click SSO Options.
trans-unit.target: Click SSO Options.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>SSO Options</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>SSO Options</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In the Single Sign-On Options section, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: In the Single Sign-On Options section, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Single Sign-On Options</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Single Sign-On Options</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Select Enable SAML Single Sign-On.
trans-unit.target: Select Enable SAML Single Sign-On.

trans-unit.source: Click Import, to upload the downloaded certificate.
trans-unit.target: Click Import, to upload the downloaded certificate.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure portal, on the Configure single sign-on at Boomi dialog page, copy the Remote Login URL value, and then paste it into the Identity Provider Login URL textbox.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure portal, on the Configure single sign-on at Boomi dialog page, copy the Remote Login URL value, and then paste it into the Identity Provider Login URL textbox.

trans-unit.source: As Federation Id Location, select Federation Id is in NameID element of the Subject.
trans-unit.target: As Federation Id Location, select Federation Id is in NameID element of the Subject.

trans-unit.source: Click Save.
trans-unit.target: Click Save.

trans-unit.source: On the Azure AD portal, select the single sign-on configuration confirmation, and then click Complete to close the Configure Single Sign On dialog.
trans-unit.target: On the Azure AD portal, select the single sign-on configuration confirmation, and then click Complete to close the Configure Single Sign On dialog.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Configure Single Sign-On</linkText>

trans-unit.source: In order to enable Azure AD users to log into Boomi, they must be provisioned into Boomi.
trans-unit.target: In order to enable Azure AD users to log into Boomi, they must be provisioned into Boomi.

trans-unit.source: In the case of Boomi, provisioning is a manual task.
trans-unit.target: In the case of Boomi, provisioning is a manual task.

trans-unit.source: Log in to your Boomi company site as administrator.
trans-unit.target: Log in to your Boomi company site as administrator.

trans-unit.source: Go to User Management \> Users.
trans-unit.target: Go to User Management \> Users.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Users</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Users</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click Add User.
trans-unit.target: Click Add User.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Add User</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Add User</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the Add User Roles dialog page, perform the following steps:
trans-unit.target: On the Add User Roles dialog page, perform the following steps:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Add User</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Add User</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Type the First Name, Last Name and Email of a valid AAD account you want to provision into the related textboxes.
trans-unit.target: Type the First Name, Last Name and Email of a valid AAD account you want to provision into the related textboxes.

trans-unit.source: Click OK.
trans-unit.target: Click OK.

trans-unit.source: You can use any other Boomi user account creation tools or APIs provided by Boomi to provision AAD user accounts.
trans-unit.target: You can use any other Boomi user account creation tools or APIs provided by Boomi to provision AAD user accounts.

trans-unit.source: To test your configuration, you need to grant the Azure AD users you want to allow using your application access to it by assigning them.
trans-unit.target: To test your configuration, you need to grant the Azure AD users you want to allow using your application access to it by assigning them.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure AD portal, create a test account.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure AD portal, create a test account.

trans-unit.source: On the Boomi **application integration page, click **Assign users.
trans-unit.target: On the Boomi **application integration page, click **Assign users.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Assign Users</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Assign Users</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Select your test user, click Assign, and then click Yes to confirm your assignment.
trans-unit.target: Select your test user, click Assign, and then click Yes to confirm your assignment.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Yes</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Yes</linkText>

trans-unit.source: If you want to test your single sign-on settings, open the Access Panel.
trans-unit.target: If you want to test your single sign-on settings, open the Access Panel.

trans-unit.source: For more details about the Access Panel, see <linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more details about the Access Panel, see <linkText>Introduction to the Access Panel</linkText><title></title>.
